claim: Brazilian states receive federal funding for each death from COVID-19 registered.
label: FALSE

claim: An unidentified virus that has affected the tomato crop in Maharashtra is a deadly form of coronavirus.
label: FALSE

claim: A Facebook post blames China as the source of a series of deadly viruses, including COVID-19, that have spread around the world since 1957.
label: Partially false

claim: Italy’s Ministry of Health has discovered that COVID-19 deaths are caused by a bacteria, not by the novel coronavirus.
label: FALSE

claim: The official Brazilial Civil Registry has showed that the total number of deaths in April decreased, instead of increased, between 2019 and 2020, during the COVID-19 pandemic.
label: FALSE

claim: Jorge Luis Sonnante published a 16-minute video that went viral on networks. In the video, Sonnante (who describes himself as a “deacon”, but gives falsified evidence of this charge) mixes several conspiracy theories, some meaningless, others already denied, about the pandemic caused by the SARS coronavirus -CoV-2.
label: FALSE

claim: Prolonged use of face masks reduces the circulation of oxygen in the blood and can lead to death.
label: FALSE

claim: Data show that the brazilian state Minas Gerais has fewer COVID-19 deaths than Ceará even though it has not adopted isolation measures
label: FALSE

claim: COVID-19 deaths are caused by bacteria and therefore the disease should be treated with aspirin.
label: FALSE

claim: A Facebook post shared thousands of times claims the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention lied about the number of deaths caused by COVID-19 by combining the count with pneumonia and influenza fatalities.
label: FALSE

claim: Data from the Civil Registry shows that, between January 1 and May 12, the total number of deaths by respiratory causes remain basically the same.
label: FALSE

claim: Graphs in which a comparison of deaths from different countries is allegedly attributed to a European report that blames the Government of Spain for deaths from coronavirus.
label: FALSE

claim: The total number of deaths in Brazil have decreased during the COVID-19 pandemic.
label: FALSE

claim: Table shows that number of death records in Brazil in April 2020 was lower than in April 2019 and April 2018.
label: MISLEADING
